channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: 5 closed Sarasota restaurants we still miss
item.description: From beloved diners to fine‑dining landmarks, Sarasota hassaid goodbye to some unforgettable restaurants in recent years.

item.title: Popeyes wings deal lets fans vote for FSU football player. Here's how
item.description: Barely a month after Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen teamed up withTampa Bay BuccaneersquarterbackBaker Mayfieldto promote the company's new chicken wings lineup, the fried chicken franchise has expanded to include college athletes by giving 10 players a chance to win a wings party at the end of the season.

item.title: Game Balls: Week 4 top Sarasota, Manatee high school football performances
item.description: Sarasota and Manatee area high school football teams lit up scoreboards in Week 4, with several local teams winning by multiple scores.

item.title: Week 4 Football Roundup: Venice, Palmetto, Booker secure big wins
item.description: A roundup of Week 4 Sarasota-Manatee county high school football games played on Friday, Sept. 12,2025

item.title: Father, education advocate launches campaign for Sarasota School board
item.description: A second candidate for the Sarasota County School Board District 1 seat has entered the upcoming race. Jimmy Glover officially filed as a candidate, with a campaign focused on putting students first and restoring respectful, solutions-driven leadership.

item.title: SMH named among 350 'smart hospitals' in the world by Newsweek
item.description: Sarasota Memorial Health Care Systemhas been named to Newsweek’s listof the “World’s Best Smart Hospitals 2026,” earning international recognition for its leadership in health technology and innovation.

item.title: Here's the weekly 2025 Sarasota and Manatee high school…
item.description: The 2025 high school football season begins with Florida High School Athletic Association Kickoff Classics on Aug. 14. The regular season begins Aug. 21 and runs through Oct. 31 (with the exception of IMG which will play into November) with most teams playing 10 games in 11 weeks.

item.title: Your guide to the 2025 Sarasota, Manatee high school…
item.description: From preseason practices through the state championship games, theHerald-Tribunewill be covering the high school football season every step of the way.

item.title: HS ROUNDUP: Palmetto girls golf, Sarasota Christian…
item.description: A roundup of high school sports contests played the week of Sept. 8-13, 2025, in Manatee and Sarasota counties.

item.title: Is Florida next? State GOP leaders respond to Trump on…
item.description: With Republican-backed redistricting plansadvancing in Texasandnow Missourithat could help the party retaincommand of Congressnext year, Florida GOP leaders may be next in line to followPresident Trump’s directive.

item.title: Top 5 concerts this week in Sarasota-Manatee
item.description: With the end ofSeptemberand the start of season in the Sarasota area approaching, we have multiple big names in this week's concert picks installment. We start with a Puerto Rican rapper and end with a North Carolina country musician, both rising stars in their respective genres with millions of TikTok followers and monthly Spotify listeners to their names, each playing Sarasota shows.

item.title: Politicians are now targets for violence. Let us protect ourselves.Commissioner Tom Knight Guest columnist
item.description: There is no denying it: political violence is now status quo in the United States.

item.title: Iconic Sarasota restaurant open since 1987 closing for remodel
item.description: One of Sarasota’s top fine-dining icons — renowned as a premier special-occasion destination and among thecity’s most romantic restaurants— will soon close for a major makeover ahead of its 40th anniversary.

item.title: Sarasota-Manatee teachers warned not to post 'despicable' comments about Charlie Kirk
item.description: Thefatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirkhas sparked a statewide conversation about teachers' social media posts – and what lines school districts can draw.

item.title: Sarasota's Stephen King apologizes for false claim about Charlie Kirk
item.description: Longtime Sarasota County resident and celebrity authorStephen King has repeatedly apologizedfor a false accusation he made about conservative activistCharlie Kirk, who was fatally shot on a Utah college campus on Sept. 10 and also owned a waterfront home in Sarasota.
